p: In weather and climate forecasting, discordant forecasts from competing models are combined into superensemble forecasts in order to offset the biases of each individual model. The resulting superensemble forecasts are more accurate than forecasts from any one model form [ 7â€“ 9]. Recent work has shown this superensemble approach to be effective in improving the accuracy of forecasts of dengue outbreaks[ 6] and influenza [ 10, 11].
